definitions.definition: A hold or way of holding, particularly with the hand .
examples: It's good to have a firm grip when shaking hands.
The ball will move differently depending on the grip used when throwing it.

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) Ability to resist slippage when pressed in contact with another object or surface.
examples: These tyres are worn out and don't have much grip .

definitions.definition: A place to grip ; a handle ; the portion of a handle that the hand occupies.
examples: There are several good grips on the northern face of this rock.
The grip of a sword is part of its hilt.

definitions.definition: A device, or a portion of one, that grasps or holds fast to something.
examples: The unthreaded portion of the bolt's shank is called the grip .

subdefinitions.definition: An apparatus attached to a car (e.g., cable car , funicular car, mine car ) for clutching a traction cable .

definitions.definition: ( Can we verify this sense?) ( figurative ) Assistance ; help ; encouragement .
( Can we verify this sense?) ( figurative ) Someone who is helpful , interesting , admirable , or inspiring .
( figurative ) Control , power , or mastery over someone or something; a tenacious grasp ; a holding fast .
examples: We need to get a grip on these spiralling costs.
in the grip of a blackmailer
to strengthen one's grip on a company
He's losing his grip – he's practically senile.
For God's sake man, stop panicking and get a grip of yourself!

definitions.definition: A medium-sized bag or holdall for one's belongings, made of soft leather, canvas etc., and carried in the hand by two handles , one either side of the opening.
( graphical user interface ) A visual component on a window etc. enabling it to be resized and/or moved by dragging with a mouse or finger.
( film or television production ) A person responsible for handling equipment on the set.
( slang ) As much as one can hold in a hand; a handful.
examples: I need to get a grip of nails for my project.

definitions.definition: ( chiefly Southern California slang ) A lot of something.
examples: That is a grip of cheese.

definitions.definition: ( chiefly Southern California slang ) A long time.
examples: I haven't seen you in a grip .

definitions.definition: ( archaic except rail transport ) A small travelling-bag or gripsack .

main_definition: A hold or way of holding, particularly with the hand .

definitions.definition: A small ditch or trench ; a channel to carry off water or other liquid; a drain .
A channel cut through a grass verge , especially for the purpose of draining water away from the highway.

main_definition: ( dialectal ) A small ditch or trench ; a channel to carry off water or other liquid; a drain .
secondary_definitions: A channel cut through a grass verge , especially for the purpose of draining water away from the highway.
